column3: str
What will you do?
Inspect the adventurer's head.
Inspect the adventurer's upper body.
Inspect the adventurer's lower body.
Inspect the adventurer's entire body.
Nothing.
Inspect the adventurer from behind.
Inspect the adventurer from the front.
Take note of any distinguishing features. Many adventurers may look alike at a glance.
Make certain that the adventurer is your client's exact double before you act!
You wish to inspect me more closely? Good, be my guest!
I trust you've seen what you need to see? Then I'll leave you to it!
Ah, of course. You'll want to take a good look at me if you're to find that mischief-making monster.
Well? Have you all the details you need? Then pray track down that imp!
Ye...ye want to take a long, hard look at me? Well, if it's to catch the imp... But keep yer eyes away from me...me tender regions!
Gotten an eyeful, have ye? Then go and catch the bloody imp!
You wish to have a proper look at me before you leave? What a marvelous idea!
I wish you luck on your search, friend. You're more than welcome to inspect me again should the need arise.
Yes, yes. Take a good look. <Emphasis>He</Emphasis> is in every way, shape, and form identical to <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>, so it is essential that you memorize my─and, in turn, his─every feature.
And do not leave without inspecting my garments, for they are <Emphasis>his</Emphasis> garments as well!
Do what you must, but pray be quick about it! Even as we speak, that fiend could be doing horrible things in my name!
You <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> find him, will you not? I dare not consider the alternative...
Oh, would you care to see how I'm dressed and such? That should help you find that awful demon.
Well, then, I'll leave you to it! Feel free to come back if you need another look!
Have you found that bleedin' imp yet? Wait, you want to take a look at <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>!?
Keep your eyes peeled, love─a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>maid<Else/>bloke</If>'s mum couldn't tell <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>him</If> an' the imp apart!
Wait, no! Put that down. I'm the real me, I swear! In fact, why not take a closer look before you go? Can't have you harassing innocent patrons with brightash, now can we?
I hope you find that horrible imp, and find him quick. Goodness knows I can't have my reputation sullied before the big tournament.
Take a close look. Closer now. I wouldn't have you mistaking some disheveled commoner for the second-most beautiful woman in the Saucer.
Some say the impostor is an <Emphasis>exact</Emphasis> double, but that would be ridiculous, for we all know by the definition of <Emphasis>exact</Emphasis> that there is room for variation.
You want to take a good look at me so you can find me? Gods, why didn't I think of that? Look, then─<Emphasis>look</Emphasis>!
I'm counting on you to stop him─to stop <Emphasis>me</Emphasis>─before it's too late!
We don't want you throwing brightash at the wrong man. Here, you'd best take note of what I'm wearing.
Done? Good hunting, then!
Very well. To catch an imp, I will submit myself to your investigation.
The voidsent's guise is perfect, my friend. Do not let it make a fool of you.
Though my purloined good looks should be unmistakable in a crowd, might I suggest you take one last look at me?
I hope that imp gets everything that's coming to him. One cannot steal this beautiful face without repercussions, you know.
Gawp all ye want, but keep them dirty dukes to yerself.
Alright! Alright! That's enough. Any more gazin' into me orbs and people might start talkin'.
Well, if you must. But don't take too long─we haven't much time!

Take care not to throw it at the first Seeker of the Sun you see. There are more than a few here <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>tonight<Else/>today</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>today<Else/>tonight</If></If> wearing outfits similar to mine.
Have you found that impish imitator? Or did you wish to appreciate my fine sense of fashion first?
The creature copied my style from the top of my head to the tip of my claws, so it shouldn't be too hard to find!

You want to <Emphasis>what</Emphasis>? I hardly think I of all people should be subject to your prying eyes.
...But do as you must.
Are you satisfied? Good. Now kindly go and find the imp!
If you think it would help, you're more than welcome to another look. Anything to help catch that horrible little monster.
I'm counting on you to teach that imp a lesson. If you need another look at my outfit, I'll be here waiting for you.
If it means finding that imp, you can eye me all you like!
Do take care when using that brightash, however. It seems I am not the only Seeker of the Sun who believes her identity stolen by the imp.
Did you find him already? What!? You're only here to inspect my garments?
Admittedly, I have been told on several occasions that I resemble someone else, so your caution may be warranted. Still, time is of the essence...
I am accustomed to lingering stares, but must you gaze with such intensity? I suppose I must endure the attention if it will aid you in banishing that upstart impostor...
You may find yourself drawn to other, lesser beauties, but I assure you, none have quite reached the same pinnacle of loveliness as I.
You would like to take a closer look at my figure? By all means, my friend.
Is there aught else you would see? No? Then may the Twelve aid you in finding the fiend.
If you're going to catch that little monster, you had best take a closer look at my clothing. The last thing we want is to be thrown out for harassing our fellow patrons.
Imps are a crafty lot, so be careful.
Commit my features to memory if you must, but be quick about it. My creditors are not the most patient of people.
Finished? Then off with you.
Huh? Er... Ye want me to strike a pose or summat?
Satisfied? Off with ye, then! That imp ain't goin' to catch himself!
Ye need to sear me ugly face into yer brain, do ye? Take a good long look, then.
Remembered all me bumps an' crags? All right, matey. Ye take me smoke bomb an' crack that voidsent bastard right 'twixt the eyes!

What strange tide landed all these folk what could be me twin here?
Eh? Ye need to look me over? Look away, mate, look away!
That's...that's all? Well, I've no intent to leave if ye need another look.
I reckon you'd be too fast to keep up with. Least I can do, though, is give you a look at my clothes before you go.
I'll wait here, in case he slips by you. Good luck!
Like I told ye, the imp has me eyes, me nose, me scars. Hells, the little devil even had the damned decency to monkey me turnout.
Ye find him for me, eh? I don't know how much longer I can take this.
Ahhh, I knew there was a reason I chose you! Kind <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> clever!
Just hold my image in your mind's eye! I know you can do it!
I never paid much attention before, but there's more than a few lads in here that could pass for me at a glance. You've only got one shot, so you'd best be sure of your target.
You'll find that imp, won't you? What if it's out there right now, ordering lunch for a hundred...?
Want to look me over, eh? Fine. But not a word about my posture.

People... Too many people.
Get that imp, so I can get out of here!
Making a mental note of my appearance should help you track the beast down.
Well, I'll leave you to it, then. If you need anything, you know where to find me.
Ah, a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> after my own heart. You, too, then realize that only through observation can one answer the riddles of the world. Observe away, my friend.
I wish you the best of luck...even though my studies have found that luck plays little part in the outcome of events such as these.
